body_html: That's a really clever method. It sounds reasonable to add an argument alias_sampler=False to the distributions.Categorical constructor. It would be even nicer if we could automatically decide whether to use the alias sampler, e.g. use it in .sample((n,)) whenever there are sufficiently many n samples to make the computation cheaper, and cache the alias table when we do compute it.

body: That's a really clever method. It sounds reasonable to add an argument `alias_sampler=False` to the `distributions.Categorical` constructor. It would be even nicer if we could automatically decide whether to use the alias sampler, e.g. use it in `.sample((n,))` whenever there are sufficiently many `n` samples to make the computation cheaper, and cache the alias table when we do compute it.
